SEARCH
Package orders

Class Order

java.lang.Object
orders.Order
All Implemented Interfaces:
OrderProcessing
public class Order extends Object implements OrderProcessing
The order processing system.
Manages the progression of customer orders, instances of a Basket as they are progressed through the system. These stages are:
Waiting to be processed
Currently being packed
Waiting to be collected
Version:
3.0
Author:
Mike Smith University of Brighton

    • getOrderState

      public Map<String,List<Integer>> getOrderState() throws OrderException
      Returns information about all the orders (there order number) in the order processing system This consists of a map with the following keys: 
       Key "Waiting"        a list of orders waiting to be processed
 Key "BeingPacked"    a list of orders that are currently being packed
 Key "ToBeCollected"  a list of orders that can now be collected
 Associated with each key is a List<Integer> of order numbers.
 Note: Each order number will be unique number.
      Specified by:
      getOrderState in interface OrderProcessing
      Returns:
      a Map with the keys: "Waiting", "BeingPacked", "ToBeCollected"
      Throws:
      OrderException
